intro: Dapania, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Dapania thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
